newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks dip on profit-taking in busy trade.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks dip on profit-taking in busy trade.

text.p: Caracas stocks shed some of this week's earlier gains, dipping amid a burst of profit-taking that, brokers say, is only a blip in an otherwise upwards trend.
"It was a very dynamic session, with both local and foreign investors paying a lot of attention... but the profit-taking was only among very selected stocks," said Financorp broker Hector Perez.
The market's 19-share index slipped 0.76 percent to close at 4,575.33 as eleven million shares traded worth 1.7 billion bolivars ($3.6 million).
Food producer Mavesa, which has led the market's rise over recent sessions, lost 2.40 bolivars to close at 115.55. Similarly, steel producer Sivensa dropped 10.00 bolivars to end at 300.00.
"It was only profit-taking," said Profimerca trader Miguel Gonzalez who sees sustained rises lying ahead for the bolsa, albeit interspersed with days of profit-taking.
Among traded issues 21 fell, 14 rose and eight closed flat. Bellwether stock Electricidad de Caracas gained 2.00 bolivars to end at 388.00.
